intro: Strychnos courteti, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts within its native habitat.
